12 reviews in English
Review from Elaine H.
133 friends 819 reviews
Elaine H.
San Francisco, CA 11/4/2008 Service - there was close to none. But what do you expect from fast food companies?? Whooper Junior - cheap, and sure beats the crap out of McDonalds cause it has freakin lettuce!! Bigger too. But of course I still can't help thinking that McDonalds is supposed to be the "happy place" for kids.
This location is huge and opens until 12am.
Was this review…?
Useful Funny Cool (1)
Add owner comment Bookmark Send to a Friend Link to This Review
Review from Lasairiona M.
Elite '12 13 friends 158 reviews
Lasairiona M.
Missouri City, TX 12/30/2011 Worst Burger King (or any fast food restaurant I've ever been to).
I just wanted to use the restroom (seriously San Franciscans, where the hell do you pee? 3 coffee shops, 2 Starbucks and NO toilet!!!!) and to queue up to use it, I had to buy something and get a token from the manager - something that wasn't just a drink.
The food was disgusting, cold, obviously reheated, the place was disgustingly dirty, trash strewn everywhere and the toilet, that I queued up for 10 minutes to use and paid $10 for the pleasure was equally as disgusting.
Avoid at all costs!
Was this review…?
Useful Funny Cool
Add owner comment Bookmark Send to a Friend Link to This Review
Review from Zain D.
Elite '12 7 friends 141 reviews
Zain D.
San Francisco, CA 10/10/2011 Service: Crappy, the guy working the register is cranky and doesn't speak English.
Price: Overpriced and underserved like most BK places.
Food: As over overpriced as it is, BK food is delicious, unless you buy it from here. The veggie burger was sloppy and falling apart. The fries were stale and cold.
You're MUCH better off walking down to In-N-Out or McDonalds, both are just a few minutes away.
Was this review…?
Useful Funny Cool
Add owner comment Bookmark Send to a Friend Link to This Review
Review from Monica N.
Elite '12 108 friends 296 reviews
Monica N.
San Francisco, CA 1/30/2011 1 Check-in Here Ugh. Slow service, the cashier was handling cash and food...yuck! I was observing the cashier, they food people made the fries, placed it in the ready to serve fries box. This guy goes and pours it back into the pile, flips the fries a little, and place in back into the box again? I waited for over 15 minutes for my turn, and there were precisely 3 person in front of me. Wow. I wonder how long this place will survive. I guess the tourist will keep it functional for now. And cashier, either put on some gloves, or wash your hands each time you touch food... cuz them money is hecka dirty.. that your handling!
Was this review…?
Useful Funny Cool
Add owner comment Bookmark Send to a Friend Link to This Review
Review from Angela H.
140 friends 497 reviews
Angela H.
Daly City, CA 10/21/2007 I didn't think that my culinary experience at Fisherman's Wharf could get any more miserable than it already was, but I was wrong- you can enter an even deeper level of gastronomic hell by dining at this Burger King! So after a miserable experience eating the crappy shrimp sandwich, I decided I wanted some onion rings. Burger King is close by and I figure that you can't go wrong with a national chain. I realize that I must have been suffering from heat stroke if I actually thought that Burger King was going to be any good.
So first off, there is a ridiculously long line full of tourists eager to partake in what the King is offering. Nothing unexpected about that at Fisherman's Wharf, but having only one cashier work that line is just plain stupid. It also didn't help that the family in front of me decided to order just about one of everything off the menu and take a good 10 minutes doing it.
Finally, I get to the front of the line, order my onion rings, and wait. And wait. And wait some more. I eventually get what was supposed to be a medium order of rings, but oh wait, the box is only half full. I'm normally not one to confront anyone, but the indignity of having to wait that long for one crappy order of onion rings take over and I can't help but bitch to the worker about the missing half of the order. Not that he cares, because he looks at the half empty box and says that is what a medium order should be. Sigh...I guess today really was my day in food hell.
Needless to say, after today's debacle, heading back to the Wharf to eat is not on my list of to-do's.
Was this review…?
Useful (4) Funny (3) Cool (1)
Add owner comment Bookmark Send to a Friend Link to This Review
Review from Jennifer L.
Elite '12 73 friends 325 reviews
Jennifer L.
San Francisco, CA 9/28/2011 1 Check-in Here I ordered a soda, and this was a mistake. I think that we have all been spoiled by McDonald's offering $1 soda's all the time, so I had a little sticker shock when I plaid $2.16 for a SMALL soda. The guy kept offering me my receipt although I told him I didn't need it. SO, either he was being way too pushy or he didn't speak english.
Was this review…?

Review from Veronica O.
32 friends 53 reviews
Veronica O.
Los Angeles, CA 12/8/2008 Fast food what can you expect, and you cant get any sauce unless you pay extra for it wich is pretty lame. The reason i gave it 2 stars is because i rather eat this horrible cancer food then buy the overpriced gimpy sea food along the side. As for going mcdonalds .. -.- i dont think they have vegi burger so burger king it is i guess if your at fishermans wharf

San Fernando, Cádiz Spain 11/17/2011 I would say burger king is ok regarding that its a fast food restaurant , there meal is big enough price is average, and the meals taste ok

Bennett W.
San Francisco, CA 8/28/2011 Located very conveniently in Fisherman's Wharf, this is one of the best Burger King locations even though I've been here once.

Review from Kyle S.
28 friends 113 reviews
Kyle S.
Mill Valley, CA 7/7/2011 This has to be the cleanest Burger King I've seen, which is surprising as its in the city. The order was fast and the food was nice and hot, no complaints.
Was this review…?

Review from Kevin G.
53 friends 332 reviews
Kevin G.
Clemmons, NC 5/12/2009 I used to work on Pier 39 and walked by this place every morning. Two stars for being able to order a Whopper for breakfast. Im not a pancake or biscuit person so much. Minus three stars for management allowing panhandlers to hang out in the restaurant. I see nothing wrong with allowing them to be there but I'd get asked for money more than once each time I was there. Plus I never really got used to saying no and feeling comfortable with it.
Was this review…?
Useful Funny (1) Cool (1)
Add owner comment Bookmark Send to a Friend Link to This Review
Review from Rhiana J.
10 friends 20 reviews
Rhiana J.
Manteca, CA 8/3/2009 Avoid the place at all costs. I work nearby and have been ripped of more than once by going here. The food is standard burger king fare at twice the normal price. The employees don't speak a word of English so it's almost possible to order and they often make substituons without asking you first.
Was this review…?
